meanings.definition: Take something from (someone) unlawfully by force or threat of force.
meanings.sent1: The thief was caught robbing a store last night.
meanings.sent2: Criminals often go to jail for robbing banks.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon was robbing the bird feeder every night.
meanings.sent4: Her constant negativity was robbing him of his joy.
meanings.sent5: The storm was robbing the trees of their colorful leaves.

meanings.definition: Deprive (someone) of something unjustly or injuriously.
meanings.sent1: The bully was robbing the younger kids of their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: Losing the game unfairly felt like someone was robbing me of victory.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was robbing the garden of all its strawberries.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise was robbing her of a peaceful night's sleep.
meanings.sent5: The illness was robbing him of his strength day by day.
